mwe.title: MWE-087: Uninitialized Local Variables
mwe.description: A local variable is either never initialized or is initialized only under certain conditions, while the variable will be used regardless of its initialization. As a result, the default zero value is used, which is not desired.
mwe.recommendation: Initialize the local variable to a reasonable value. Explicitly setting it to zero if it is meant to be initialized to zero.

mwe.title: MWE-051: Missing Input Validation
mwe.description: In solidity, there is no "null" equivalent. So we should know every default value for different value types. Meanwhile, we should validate the value passed to state variable. So, for example, when we assign an address type, we should check the value to ensure it's not a zero address.
mwe.recommendation: Validate input value.

mwe.title: MWE-084: Possible Usage of a Variable before Declaration
mwe.description: Detects the possible usage of a variable before the declaration is stepped over (either because it is later declared or declared in another scope).
mwe.recommendation: Move all variable declarations before any variable usage, and ensure that reaching a variable declaration does not depend on some conditional if used unconditionally.

mwe.title: MWE-052: Missing Error Message
mwe.description: `require` can be used to check for conditions and throw an exception if the condition is not met, in which case the error message provided by the developer will appear. This is why a very descriptive error message is needed.
mwe.recommendation: Adding an error message describing the failed condition.

results.show_title: MWE-052: Missing Error Message  in lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/governance/Governor.sol

mwe.title: MWE-0123: Possibility of Price manipulation with Balances
mwe.description:
Potential price manipulation risk:
	- In function _delegate
		-- delegatorBalance = balanceOf(delegator) (lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Votes.sol#213) have potential price manipulated risk from delegatorBalance and call None which could influence variable:delegatorBalance
mwe.recommendation: It is recommended to use the chainlink oracle to obtain data, or to avoid relying on easily manipulated variables, or to use the TWAP mechanism.

results.show_title: MWE-0123: Possibility of Price manipulation with Balances in src/lockers/OCL/OCL_ZVE.sol

mwe.title: MWE-076: DoS with Block Gas Limit
mwe.description: When smart contracts are deployed, functions inside them are called, and the execution of these actions always requires a certain amount of gas based on how much computation is needed to complete them. The Ethereum network specifies a block gas limit, and the sum of all transactions included in a block can not exceed the threshold.\nProgramming patterns that are harmless in centralized applications can lead to Denial of Service conditions in smart contracts when the cost of executing a function exceeds the block gas limit. For example, modifying an array of unknown size that increases over time can lead to a Denial of Service condition.
mwe.recommendation: Caution is advised when you expect to have large arrays that grow over time. Actions that require looping across the entire data structure should be avoided.\n If you absolutely must loop over an array of unknown size, then you should plan for it to take multiple blocks and potentially require multiple transactions.

results.show_title: MWE-076: DoS with Block Gas Limit  in src/lockers/OCY/OCY_Convex_B.sol

mwe.title: MWE-117: Unnecessary Public Function Modifier
mwe.description: Detect the public function which can be replaced with external
mwe.recommendation: Replace public with external

results.show_title: MWE-117: Unnecessary Public Function Modifier in lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/draft-ERC20Permit.sol

mwe.title: MWE-073: Floating Pragma
mwe.description: An unlocked compiler version like ^0.8.0 in the contract's source code permits the user to compile it at or above a particular version, which leads to differences in the generated bytecode between compilations due to differing compiler version numbers. As a result, compiler-specific bugs may occur in the codebase that would be hard to identify throughout multiple compiler versions rather than a specific one, which can cause ambiguity. Moreover, the contracts may be at the risk of being accidentally deployed using an outdated compiler version which can introduce bugs to affect the contract system negatively.
mwe.recommendation: Lock the compiler version to the lowest version possible so that the contract can be compiled and consider known bugs for the chosen compiler version.

results.show_title: MWE-073: Floating Pragma in lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/Ownable.sol

mwe.title: MWE-011: Potential Constant State Variables
mwe.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.
mwe.recommendation: Add the `constant` attributes to state variables that never change.

results.show_title: MWE-011: Potential Constant State Variables in src/lockers/OCY/OCY_Convex_B.sol
